vehicles.description: There is a white van on the left lane ahead, moving in the same direction as our vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: The white van may slow down, stop, or change lanes, which will affect the speed and lane choice of one's own vehicle.

vehicles.description: An orange forklift is located on the right side of the road, moving parallel to the direction of our vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: Forklifts represent a mobile hazard, as their operation might unpredictably encroach upon this lane.

traffic signs.description: A blue circular sign with a white arrow and bicycle symbol, indicating a bike lane to the right.
traffic signs.explanation: Drivers are advised to be alert and watch out for cyclists; they may need to give way or avoid the bicycle lanes.

traffic signs.description: On the right side, a circular "No Entry" sign with red and white stripes is on the white wall.
traffic signs.explanation: This vehicle is not allowed to enter this area and should remain on the current road.

barriers.description: To the right, there are obstacles or fences surrounding a construction site or restricted area.
barriers.explanation: This limits the area for driving on the right and guides the vehicle to stay in the current lane or to move left when necessary.

barriers.description: To the left, a metal traffic barrier is visible, which partially divides the road.
barriers.explanation: These obstacles may reduce the navigable road space and could lead to changes in traffic patterns, requiring the vehicle itself to recognize these changes.

other objects.description: An electronic illuminated billboard has been installed above the road on the right, displaying text or advertisements.
other objects.explanation: Although this object does not directly affect driving behavior, its bright illumination and content may distract the driver or vehicle sensors.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there are multiple road users and relevant objects affecting driving behavior. Firstly, regarding vehicles, there is a white van on the left lane ahead, moving in the same direction as our vehicle, which may slow down, stop, or change lanes, potentially affecting the speed and lane choice of our vehicle. Additionally, an orange forklift is positioned on the right side of the road, moving parallel to our vehicle, representing a mobile hazard as its operation could unpredictably encroach upon our lane.

In terms of traffic signs, there is a blue circular sign with a white arrow and bicycle symbol that indicates a bike lane to the right, requiring drivers to be alert and watch out for cyclists, potentially giving way or avoiding the bicycle lanes. Another sign on the right side is a circular "No Entry" sign with red and white stripes on a white wall, signifying that our vehicle is not allowed to enter this area and should remain on the current road.

Barriers are also present in the image. On the right, there are obstacles or fences surrounding a construction site or restricted area, limiting the driving area on the right and guiding the vehicle to stay in the current lane or move left if necessary. On the left, a metal traffic barrier is visible, partially dividing the road and potentially reducing the navigable space, which could lead to changes in traffic patterns, requiring the vehicle to recognize these changes.

Finally, there is another object, an electronic illuminated billboard installed above the road on the right, displaying text or advertisements. Though it does not directly affect driving behavior, its bright illumination and content may distract the driver or vehicle sensors.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance from the white van ahead, ready to respond to any deceleration or stopping. Stay alert for the movements of the orange forklift, as it may enter the roadway. Obey traffic signs, avoid driving into the bike lane, and be aware of potential cyclists. Respect the "Do Not Enter" signs and continue along the current route. Since there are obstacles on the right, the vehicle should stay in its own lane and not attempt any right turns that might enter restricted areas. Drive carefully, pay close attention to industrial vehicles crossing from left to right, ensure correct lane positioning to avoid the parked white van on the right, and watch for cyclists due to the indicated bike lane.

1.description and explanation: This is a construction vehicle, indicated as a vehicle typically used for construction work, such as a forklift. It is currently operational in the middle of the roadway or crossing it. Due to its presence, the ego vehicle should slow down and be ready to stop if necessary. The driver should watch for any sudden movements from the construction vehicle and proceed with caution, giving it the right of way if it is in the process of working or crossing.
